intro: Otostegia minuccii, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is well adapted to arid environments. It produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous seeds. Otostegia minuccii is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
